meanings.definition: To equip or supply with military forces
meanings.sent1: The country was militarizing its borders to protect its citizens.
meanings.sent2: The government was militarizing the army with new weapons and equipment.
meanings.sent3: The school cafeteria was militarizing the lunch menu with new healthy options.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were militarizing the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The chef was militarizing the kitchen, preparing for a busy dinner service.

meanings.definition: To organize or adapt for military purposes
meanings.sent1: The general was militarizing the troops for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent2: The captain was militarizing the ship for battle at sea.
meanings.sent3: The ants were militarizing their ranks to defend against the invading beetles.
meanings.sent4: The chess player was militarizing their strategy, ready to conquer the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent5: The coach was militarizing the team's plays for the championship game.

meanings.definition: To make military in character or appearance
meanings.sent1: The costume designer was militarizing the outfits for the action movie.
meanings.sent2: The decorator was militarizing the event space for the military-themed party.
meanings.sent3: The kids were militarizing their playtime, pretending to be soldiers on a secret mission.
meanings.sent4: The artist was militarizing the painting with bold, army-inspired colors.
meanings.sent5: The actor was militarizing their performance, embodying the role of a tough soldier.
